page.title: 19Changing Village Life
page.content:
Some older inhabitants deplore the lack of amenities in their village. The shop and Post Office closed 8 years ago and in recent years the bus services have been greatly curtailed.
Prices of houses are high, and fewer available for renting, so that young people wishing to marry have to move away from the area. Mechanisation on the farms means that there is less employment available for them near their homes.
There is no village Pub or Inn where people can meet socially. Only the churches and the village hall provide meeting places. The imminent closure of the village school was contested by the community, but now seems to be inevitable.
